comment_section: # this is an attributes file for an SLT extension
# it will also contain this structure, letting SLT know what attributes to track
# this is a comment because it starts with an octothorpe(#)
# otherwise this file has to be proper json
# it is divided into a 'triggers' block and a 'settings' block
# the blocks are otherwise the same, following the same naming convention
trigger_attributes: # this section is just a simple list of attributes
triggerattribute_event: # here is where you define aspects of the attribute
Choose which type of awesome event this trigger will use.
triggerattribute_chance: The chance the trigger will run when all prerequisites are met.
triggerattribute_race: The 'race' of a scene participant for the script to run on them.
triggerattribute_role: The role of a scene participant with regard to aggression.
triggerattribute_player: The relationship to the Player of a scene participant.
triggerattribute_gender: The SexLab gender of a scene participant.
triggerattribute_tag: The SexLab 'tag' for the animation the scene participant is in.
triggerattribute_daytime: The time of day the scene is taking place in.
triggerattribute_location: The location, indoors or outdoors, the scene is taking place in.
triggerattribute_position: The SexLab 'position' the scene participant is in (1-5).
triggerattribute_do_1: You can run up to 3 commands associated with this keymapping. This is the first.
triggerattribute_do_2: You can run up to 3 commands associated with this keymapping. This is the second.
triggerattribute_do_3: You can run up to 3 commands associated with this keymapping. This is the third.
